original: Åkerman, Richard Oskar Roger, överste, Linköping, f. 6/7/98 i Sthlm av gen:löjtn. Joachim Å. o. Martina Björnstjerna. G. 20 m. Thyra Sellén, f. 25/12/99 av prof., övdöjtn. Nils S. o. Ragnhild Frisk. Barn: Joachim f. 21, fiskalsaspirant i Svea hovrätt, Stockholm, Elsie 23, g. m. löjtn. Torsten Bendz, Linköping, Thyra 26, stud. v. konstfacksk,., Sthlm. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 16, fänr. v. Svea art:reg. 19, löjtn. 23, kapt. v. gen:stäb. 31, major v. gen istahskåren 39, avsk. 39, major 39 o. öv rlöjtn. 40 i finska armén, åter major v. sv. gen:stabskår. 40, öv:löjtn. 41, överste 43. Gen istabsoff. v. västra arméförd. 311-33, chef f. gen :stab. luft-försv:detalj 34-37, batt :chef v. Svea art:reg. 37-39, lär. v. flygkrigshögsk. 39 o. 41-42, lär. i strategi v. KHS 40-42, chef f. KHS 42-46, chef f. Lv 2 i Linköp. fr. 46. Till 30 års försv:komm. förfog. 36, t. 41 års försv :utredn. förfog. 41, led. O’. sekr. i komm. ang. fri v. anskaffn. av luftv:mtrl 37, av K. Maj :t förordn. omb. i CFB verkst. utsk. 38- 42. Ordf. i Bromma luftsk :fören. 44-45. KS02kil, RNO, RVO, FFrK3kl m sv, Landst GM, RLSF ftjM, RLSFGftjt, FMM, LKrVA.
translated: Åkerman, Richard Oskar Roger, Colonel, Linköping, b. 6/7/98 in Stockholm, son of Lieutenant General Joachim Å. and Martina Björnstjerna. Married on 20 m. Thyra Sellén, b. 25/12/99, daughter of Professor, Lieutenant Colonel Nils S. and Ragnhild Frisk. Children: Joachim b. 21, fiscal apprentice at the Svea Court of Appeal, Stockholm, Elsie b. 23, married to Lieutenant Torsten Bendz, Linköping, Thyra b. 26, studying at the University College of Arts, Stockholm. — Passed the school leaving exam in Stockholm in 16, commissioned officer at the Svea Artillery Regiment in 19, promoted to Lieutenant in 23, Captain at the General Staff in 31, Major in the General Staff Corps of the Swedish Coastal Artillery in 39, retired in 39, reinstated as Major in the Swedish General Staff Corps in 40, promoted to Lieutenant Colonel in 41, Colonel in 43. General Staff Officer at the Western Army Command, 311-33, Chief of the General Staff Air Defense Section, 34-37, Battalion Commander at the Svea Artillery Regiment, 37-39, instructor at the Air War College, 39 and 41-42, instructor in strategy at the Royal Swedish Military Academy, 40-42, Chief of the Royal Swedish Military Academy, 42-46, Chief of Air Base 2 in Linköping from 46. Available for the 30-year Defense Commission in 36, available for the 41-year Defense Investigation in 41, member and secretary of the committee for the procurement of air defense material in 37, appointed commissioner in the Armed Forces Central Board Executive Committee, 38-42. Chairman of the Bromma Air School Association, 44-45. Knight of the Order of the Seraphim, Commander First Class of the Royal Order of the Sword, Commander of the Royal Victorian Order, Knight of the French Legion of Honour, Grand Master of the Order of the Sword, Commander First Class, Military Merit Cross, Officer of the National Red Cross Gold Medal, Officer of the National Red Cross Silver Cross, Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences.

structured.name: Richard Oskar Roger Åkerman
careerHighlights: Commissioned Officer at the Svea Artillery Regiment (1919)
Major in the Swedish Coastal Artillery (1939)
Reinstated as Major in the Swedish General Staff Corps (1940)
General Staff Officer at the Western Army Command (1931-1933)
Chief of the General Staff Air Defense Section (1934-1937)
Battalion Commander at the Svea Artillery Regiment (1937-1939)
Instructor at the Air War College (1939, 1941-1942)
Instructor in Strategy at the Royal Swedish Military Academy (1940-1942)
Chief of the Royal Swedish Military Academy (1942-1946)
Chief of Air Base 2 in Linköping (from 1946)

committees.name: Committee for the Procurement of Air Defense Material
Armed Forces Central Board Executive Committee

honors: Knight of the Order of the Seraphim
Commander First Class of the Royal Order of the Sword
Commander of the Royal Victorian Order
Knight of the French Legion of Honour
Grand Master of the Order of the Sword, Commander First Class
Officer of the National Red Cross Gold Medal
Officer of the National Red Cross Silver Cross
Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences
